publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2990 Mr Mark Ruskell: Africa: Up in Smoke?—That the Parliament congratulates the Working Group on Climate Change and Development on the publication of its second report, Africa: Up in Smoke?; notes that international efforts to combat poverty in Africa and other parts of the developing world can only be effective when combined with urgent global action on climate change; believes that a new approach to economic development is needed by the G8 based on an agreed framework for emissions cuts that goes far beyond the targets laid out by the Kyoto Protocol, and calls on all G8 governments to make immediate, effective action to tackle global climate change a top priority.
S2M-2990 Africa: Up in Smoke? (lodged on 20 June 2005) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-2990 Africa: Up in Smoke? (lodged on 20 June 2005) Mike Pringle*, Patrick Harvie*, Eleanor Scott*, Shiona Baird*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-2990 Africa: Up in Smoke? (lodged on 20 June 2005) Mark Ballard*, Robin Harper*

S2M-2990 Mr Mark Ruskell:Africa: Up in Smoke?—That the Parliament congratulates the Working Group on Climate Change and Development on the publication of its second report, Africa: Up in Smoke?; notes that international efforts to combat poverty in Africa and other parts of the developing world can only be effective when combined with urgent global action on climate change; believes that a new approach to economic development is needed by the G8 based on an agreed framework for emissions cuts that goes far beyond the targets laid out by the Kyoto Protocol, and calls on all G8 governments to make immediate, effective action to tackle global climate change a top priority. Supported by: Ms Rosemary Byrne, Rosie Kane, Mike Pringle, Patrick Harvie, Eleanor Scott, Shiona Baird, Chris Ballance, Mark Ballard, Robin Harper
S2M-2990 Africa: Up in Smoke? (lodged on 20 June 2005) Tommy Sheridan*
